newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesia late palm olein stable in slow trade.
newsitem.headline: Indonesia late palm olein stable in slow trade.

text.p: Indonesian palm olein prices were generally stable in late trading on Tuesday, ignoring news that Pakistan had devalued its currency, traders said.
They said olein stayed at 1,360-65 rupiah/kg in Jakarta, but quotes were also heard at 1,350-55 rupiah for small offtakes.
Crude palm oil was done at an equivalent of 1,145 rupiah/kg at a 500-tonne tender in Medan, where it fetched 1,165 rupiah at a tender last week.
Traders said that while Pakistan's 7.86 percent-devaluation of its rupee against the dollar was considered bearish news, it did not have any impact on the local market.

"Pakistan has to buy what it has to consume. It will not stop buying oil just because it has become more expensive for it," one trader said. "But there is the possibility that the amounts purchased by Pakistan might be reduced."
Another trader said the devaluation move could trigger a move to step up Pakistan's production of oilseeds, but added that that process could take time.
Traders, meanwhile, said local buying interest remained thin on expectations of a continued weakening in prices.
